snippet: Turkish officials are demanding ancient artifacts from Western museums, and aren’t timid about doing so. The museums say their mission to display global art treasures is under siege.
abstract: Turkey's aggressive campaign to reclaim antiquities it says were looted, has drawn condemnation from some of the world’s largest museums, which call the campaign cultural blackmail; efforts have spurred an international debate about who owns antiquities after centuries of shifting borders; major museums around the world say their mission to display global art treasures is under siege from Turkey’s tactics.
lead_paragraph: Turkish officials are demanding ancient artifacts from Western museums, and aren’t timid about doing so. The museums say their mission to display global art treasures is under siege.

headline.seo: Turkey’s Efforts to Repatriate Art Alarm Museums
headline.main: Seeking Return of Art, Turkey Jolts Museums
headline.print_headline: Seeking Return Of Art, Turkey Jolts Museums
